title: Which Marvin Gaye song would be popular if it was released today? - Quora

response.answer_text: To me, the answer is obvious: “What’s Going On” and “Mercy Mercy Me (The Ecology),” both released in 1971. It’s a damn shame that both of these songs are still so resonant today. I was 17 when they first filled my ears, and I sang along with Marvin wholeheartedly, envisioning a world in which the issues he addressed would no longer exist by the time I reached my 60s. I wasn’t foolish to have that vision; I wasn’t wrong to want it. I just had absolutely no idea how backward, wrong-headed, cold-hearted, and greedy our so-called “leaders” would be in the 21st century.
I think ANY song that he’s done would work, but I think “Heard it through the Grapevine “ would chart high. Awesome song!
